items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message: High spring tides are forecast over the coming days. Forecast high water is 20:45 on 07/10/21 with a level of 7.43 mAOD and a Force 2 Southerly wind. Tomorrow morning’s tide is not forecast to reach flood alert thresholds. Times are local and refer to the high water time at Avonmouth, however conditions may apply one to two hours either side of the high tide. mAOD is height above average sea level for more detail refer to local tide tables. There is a possibility of high water levels for the tidal River Avon from Sea Mills to Conham in Bristol and between the Avonmouth Bridge and Shirehampton Park including Pill and Shirehampton. Flooding to roads and farmland is possible but properties are not expected to flood at this point. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff will be on site closing flood gates. Be careful along beaches and low lying coastal footpaths and roads. This message will be updated by midday, Friday 08/10/2021.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.58mAOD at 16:15 on 07/10/21 and 4.61mAOD at 04:45 on 08/10/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 93 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 09:30 on 08/10/21, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 12:45 AM on 08/10/2021. Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale. Highest tide level is at 12:45 AM on 08/10/2021. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time. Weather conditions are expected to produce large onshore waves. We are also expecting the following 2 high tides to exceed the Flood Alert threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Plan driving routes to avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Thursday and Friday evening. High water at Ilfracombe is at 7.33pm on Thursday and 8:13pm on Friday, and times of high water will vary along the coast.

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.

Impacts include minor flooding of roads and the possibility of some spray overtopping, but is not expected to result in property flooding.

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Illfracombe is 5.02 mAOD.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. The period of high spring tides continues for the next few days, and further alerts may be issued.  We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: Levels remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck, Derwentwater and surrounding watercourses. Flooding is likely to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwentwater. This Flood Alert is likely to remain in place for several days. A Flood Warning is also in place for Keswick Campsite. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

The level of Derwentwater remains high following several days of rain earlier in the week. Areas most at risk of flooding include low lying land bordering the shores of Derwentwater and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. The lake level is now dropping but remains above the Flood Warning level. We will continue to monitor water levels and update this warning if necessary. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. No further rainfall is forecast for the next 48 hours.
We are continuing to monitor the situation.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: Water levels are high on Windermere, Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel due to several days of heavy rain. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

Following the rain that fell early in the week, river levels remain high on the River Roding on Thursday 7 October, but are now beginning to fall. Flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river may continue to affect the areas of Abridge, Loughton and Buckhurst Hill. Flooding from surface water may also remain.

We expect the river levels to continue to slowly fall over the coming days.  No further significant rain is forecast over the next few days.

Take care near the areas of concern and avoid entering flood water.

We are continuing to monitor river levels and have staff in the field checking for and clearing blockages.

This message will be updated by 10am on Friday 8 October or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: The Western Rother is still high through Fittleworth following Tuesday morning's heavy rain, but it is now slowly falling. Minor flood impacts will continue to affect fields, rural roads and gardens near Fittleworth Mill, Fittleworth. Very little rain is forecast in the next 5 days, which will enable river levels to fall further. However, normal flows will not return to Fittleworth until the weekend. River levels between Liss and Midhurst and at Lodsbridge near Selham are already near normal. Please keep flood protection measures in place in Fittleworth while residual flood impacts remain. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast and reissue this message if the risk of property flooding increases.

items.description: River Anker at Mancetter, Witherley and Atherstone

items.message: The River Arun is still high between Newbridge near Billingshurst and Pallingham Quay, but is now slowly falling. Minor flood impacts will continue to affect fields, gardens and rural roads in these areas. Very little rain is forecast in the next 5 days, which will enable river levels to fall further. However, normal flows will not return to Pallingham Quay until Sunday (10/10/2021). River levels through Horsham and Broadbridge Heath are already near normal. Please keep flood protection products in place at Newbridge and Pallingham Quay while residual flood impacts remain. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast and reissue this message if the risk of property flooding increases.

The River Arun at Pulborough is still high following a very wet start to October, but looks to have now approached its peak. Water will be extensive through fields, and could affect gardens and approach properties on Lower Street and Swan Corner, Pulborough, near to Swan Bridge and Bridge Cottages, Greatham. At 14:30 on Thursday (07/10/2021), the river at Houghton Bridge, Amberley will peak at a similar height to that seen on Wednesday lunchtime (06/10/2021), with water close to the tops of the banks. Flooding is not currently expected this week in Arundel or Ford. Very little rain is forecast for the next 5 days. River levels at Pulborough should begin to slowly fall from 16:00 today (07/10/2021), but flows will not reduce significantly until next week. Please keep flood protection products in place, if you have them. Our pumps in Pulborough are running to help reduce the risk of flooding. We will update this message by 20:00 on 07/10/2021.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We continue to monitor the situation.

The risk of flooding from the upper River Roding in the areas of Molehill Green, Dunmow, Ongar, Fyfield, High Ongar and Stapleford has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  No further rainfall is forecast.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Swale, Cod Beck, Bedale Beck

items.message: This flood warning has been removed as river levels have fallen below the level of concern. A Flood Alert remains in force following heavy overnight rainfall. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and avoid any unnecessary danger.

This Flood Alert has been removed as levels have fallen below levels of concern. No significant rainfall is forecast over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and will re-issue this alert if necessary.

This Flood Alert has been removed as levels have fallen below levels of concern. No significant rainfall is forecast over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and will re-issue this alert if necessary.
This flood alert has been removed as river levels have fallen below the level of concern. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and avoid any unnecessary danger.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed as levels have fallen below levels of concern. No significant rainfall is forecast over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and will re-issue this alert if necessary.

Property flooding is not expected.  High tide is expected at Trowlock Island at 4:30pm this afternoon (07/10/21). The river may over top banks and flood low lying land and footpaths. The predicted height of the tide is 4.85 - 5.05 metres. Both previous high tides were slightly higher than forecast, with the high tide this morning reaching just above flood alert level (5.07 metres).  Therefore we will continue to closely monitor the forecast and tide heights. This message will be updated this evening (07/10/21).

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Lizard Point to Gribbin Head excluding Truro City
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible this evening and for tomorrow’s high spring tides. High water at Truro is at 6.57pm tonight (Thursday 07 October).  High tides for tomorrow (Friday 08 October), are at  7.20am and 7.38pm, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Force 4 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 2m are forecast, and may cause minor wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal areas.   

Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Newlyn is 2.88 mAOD, this is 0.03 metres below astronomical tide level. 

From Saturday onwards the tide levels begin to decrease. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue an update on Saturday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 01:00 AM on 08/10/2021.
Areas most at risk include Coastline from Gretna to Silloth.
Highest tide level is expected to be at Coastline from Gretna to Silloth at 01:00 AM on 08/10/2021. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time.
After this tide no further impacts are expected.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Plan driving routes to avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 01:45 AM on 08/10/2021. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads at Fiddlers Ferry, Eastford Road, Arpley Bridge and Knutsford Road. It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads at Fiddlers Ferry, Eastford Road, Arpley Bridge and Knutsford Road. It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge between 02:15 AM and 02:45 AM on 08/10/2021. We are expecting higher than normal night time tides over the next two days and as a result we may issue further alerts or warnings. The weather isforecast to be largely calm with light winds and high pressure which is limiting tidal surge.  No significant rain is forecast. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 09/10/2021, or as the situation changes.
